Here is my attempt to clarify what Jen started (and i confused).

@Jen Lampton - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1svJioZPoF9Ex7e5icMa4KGkOsQ23cLSNNHxGW6iEiBk/edit

My (incomplete) attempt to revise that and add some comments:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1svJioZPoF9Ex7e5icMa4KGkOsQ23cLSNNHxGW6iEiBk/edit
@StPaulTim I read over your google doc and about half-way through you go into all the stuff contrib could theoretically do, but it;s all out of scope for the core issue.
I put in bold text break at that point.
I need to run for a bit but if you want to hop on another zoom and chat it out I'd be happy to do that. I'll be around tomorrow after 1pm PT

@Jen Lampton - I did that, because my understanding was that the primary purpose of the issue was to make these things easier. It was my understanding that the UI we were creating was secondary to that purpose.
BUT, I have since learned that is no longer the case.
well, you are correct in that our primary purpose was to make these things easier -- but easier for contrib modules to complete
I understand that.
the UI we are creating just needs to do what core does now, but in a way that's not broken, and not confusing
the latter being what prevented it from going into 1.15
Sure, well it's clear to me now that there are really two different issues at play.
I added a paragraph in there that I hope clarifies the pain-points
OK, I'll look shortly. We can talk later.
(maybe that also wasn't necessary, but it helped me to write it out)
If you guys do that zoom meeting tomorrow (or any day FTM), please let me know; keen to join the discussion.
@Jen Lampton - The entire reason for my draft was because it helps me to write out my own thoughts on an issue like this. That document may not be helpful for others, but it was for me.
Yay I finally installed the Zulip client! This seems a little easier/nicer. :)
Didn't occur to me that the web version might be different. I have't looked at it in a long time.
TBH I am preferring Zulip more and more
Yeah, it grew on me gradually too :)

Created custom content type number 15(!) for my current project. The customer (who knows several CMSes) is impressed how easy this can be done. Backdrop CMS really rocks for mid-sized projects #pitchingbackdrop
@Jen Lampton we were talking about this late last week, but I can't remember where. Anyway, if you want to have a call about this, maybe tomorrow or Thursday. It's been a really busy week.
sure. we could do thursday before the meetings? tomorrow I'm only free after 1pm PT
Let's just do Thurs before the meeting

Forward Revisions 0r Better Workflow States
Tim’s Version I tried to pull as much as possible from Jen’s draft and clarify a few things, while adding a few of my own opinions. In this draft, I’ve adopted the “current” label for the default or active revision. I still think that with a slightly different model, we could use “published” in ...
I had to step away to talk with someone. looks like our meeting ended without me, which is fine. I had nothing more to contribute.
It felt like we made some good decisions. Thanks all - I feel much better about this issue.
Just confirming: Are we using Tim's doc as the source of truth moving forward?

@docwilmot - I'll work on updating this now. https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/1475#issuecomment-605554757

I welcome corrections or comments from anyone...

@docwilmot - is this clear enough to work from? Does it makes sense to you and do you have any additional thoughts?

[D8][WP][UX] Forward Revisions · Issue #4354 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Because issue #1475 has drifted from it's original intention and gone through so many changes/discussion, we decided to close that issue and open two new issues - including this one. Descriptio...
@docwilmot you may want to wait until @klonos and/or @jenlampton are able to confirm that I've properly captured the consensus before doing more work. But, I believe I have it pretty close.

I also created this issue: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4355 as a new issue for Better Workflow states. I would love to have someone else write a better issue summary.

[D8][WP][UX] Better/advanced Workflow States · Issue #4355 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need We are breaking #1475 into two distinct issues. We created #4354 for Forward resvisions and are creating this issue to address the need for Better/advanced Workflow states. ...
Oh wow youve done a lot of work there. I'm starting to feel a bit bad that I've created more work with this than its worth. apologies for the confusion.

@docwilmot - Not necessary. I've been feeling bad for my own role in slowing this issue down. But, I think this is going to be a pretty nice feature and I think the extra work that went into it now will hopefully pay off later.
@docwilmot FYI - https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/co-working-backdrop
@docwilmot there was a reason why I (we?) have been deferring summarizing that issue :sweat_smile: ...but yeah, having that realtime meeting with @jenlampton and @StPaulTim helped a lot.

@StPaulTim I've restarted work, from the document. But I'm struck though by the dramatic shift in our approach to node form changes! We started off wanting it seems to limit any significant changes to the node form. See this issue comment by @quicksketch, although maybe I was misinterpreting his comment again. But now we've added extra buttons, renamed links, etc. I think the proposed changes are good, but I'm dreading to go deep into this and then we decide its too much again.

[D8][WP][UX] Better workflow states and content save options. · Issue #1475 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
This might actually be split to quite a few separate issues (some might have already been filed), but before we go ahead and do that, let's draft a plan here... Here's what we have in Backd...

@docwilmot Good question. I have to say that I was a bit confused during that stage of the discussion. Remember, this draft if primarily from @jenlampton, @klonos, and myself. No core commiters (including @Nate Lampton) have explicitly signed off on this.

It might make sense to get a core committer to review this, before we get too far.
Yeah, probably right. I'll park again. Sigh.

That's unfortunate, but I understand. You understand better than me, where the problematic issues are.

I would say, that the actual node form buttons is where I think we've had the most difficulty coming to a consensus on what is best.
I will post a comment in the issue calling attention to this question.
Feature freeze is in just over 3 weeks. :frown:

I'm going back right now to look at your last PR and look closer at @Nate Lampton s concerns to see if I can understand them better and possible make some suggestions. I'm seeing some things that our recent document doesn't address very well.

@docwilmot - I just spent time reviewing the discussion on this issue from Nov & Dec and I think the only one raising concerns about large changes to the UI at that time was @Nate Lampton and I THINK that those concerns were mostly based upon the status of the PR at that time. It's not clear to me, that @Nate Lampton was inherently against larger changes, if they make sense.

It seems to be, that if we took the concerns he was raising at the time very literally, we would have taken this PR is a very different direction. While @Nate Lampton has not explicitly endorsed this proposal. He is very much aware of the discussions we were having and I assume he has at least skimmed the text and seen some of the screenshots

So, in my view - you know much better than me how much work is involved in making these changes and thus how much risk is involved in moving forward without explicit core committer endorsement. So, you need to decide how much certainty you need to proceed.
@docwilmot ++
docwilmot thanks for all you do (Karma: 5)
